comments.purpose: To measure the number of red blood cells in a blood sample. This provides information about and blood cell production count, oxygen carrying capacity, RBC lifespan, causes for abnormalities such as deficiency diseases (e.g., anemia), iron-deficiency, chronic bleeding (trauma, hemorrhagic ulcers), menstruation, leukemias and other malignancies, dysplasias, some nutritional deficiencies (vitamin B12, folate) etc. Laboratory diagnoses of marrow disorders can be made based on the examination of bone marrow aspirates/cores in conjunction with a peripheral blood count and film.
